basics.name: Jonathan Lau
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a senior in computer engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2019 & hope to pursue a career in software development.

work.summary: Teaching assistant for computer programming and modern computing environments in C
highlights: Teaching a laboratory section that covers an introduction to C programming & basic software development skills
Hold office hours to assist students and grade laboratory assignments

work.summary: Online tutor to help assist students in K-12 & college level courses
highlights: Assist students by simplifying math and science concepts while guiding students to think critically and solve problems
Work through an online interface while communicating through voice and text chat rooms

work.summary: Software developer focused on product testing at RevaComm
highlights: Setup end-to-end testing solution using nightwatch.js and selenium web driver for a browser based application
Wrote testing scripts using Javascript and CSS/Xpath selectors to monitor site usability and report malfunctions
Scripts reported issues for website overload, response times, functionality between versions, and memory storage
Wrote various utility scripts in Python to filter data output logs

work.summary: Designed electromagnetic torque rods for a CubeSat
highlights: Designed parts using Matlab and Solidworks programs
Worked in constructing various parts in a machine shop
Tested torque rods for efficiency and physical durability

volunteer.summary: Developer for firmware & algorithms of an autonomous robot
highlights: Developed firmware in C for a STM32 microprocessor to drive DC motors with a closed-loop control system
Desiged and implemented flood-fill and tracking algorithms to solve a maze
Designed and developed low-cost, accurate, and reliable environmental sensor modules
Developed firmware in Arduino for an ATmega328 microcontroller to retrieve sensor data
